sidebar.text: These days, I am developing with a wide array of technologies across the full stack.

content.title: Tech Stack
content.subtitle: I have a diversified tech stack

elements.name: javascript
elements.benefit: I grew up on the web... And Javascript is the language of the web. So, I basically speak Javascript.

elements.name: backbone
elements.benefit: Disorganized code is disgusting. So, to keep my front-end code DRY, maintainable, and scalable, I prefer using Backbone.

elements.name: html5
elements.benefit: While I enjoy building native apps, I prefer to build apps that run everywhere. That's why HTML5 is an important part of my tech stack.

elements.name: css3
elements.benefit: While I lack the skills of visual design, CSS enables me to express my creativity. I use CSS to augment the experiences I create for users.

elements.name: d3
elements.benefit: To gain insights from data, that data must be visualized. D3 is awesome at this and plays an important role in my tech stack for data products.

elements.name: nodejs
elements.benefit: Asynchronous, server-side Javascript is a game-changer! With Node, I can develop across the full stack!

elements.name: expressjs
elements.benefit: Using Express to build RESTful APIs is amazing. I mostly use Express as a corner piece for building modern scalable web-services.

elements.name: mongo
elements.benefit: Along with Node and Express, Mongo completes my server-side tech stack as my preferred data store.

elements.name: r
elements.benefit: I don't always need to process data. But, when I do, I prefer to use R! It's also great for prototyping data products.

elements.name: javascript
elements.benefit: I like using Javascript for data manipulation, too, though balancing processing responsibility between client and server is tricky!
